result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick M Tesar Sr.

defendant.name: Tesar, Patrick M, Sr.

records.addlTxt: Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:34 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. in court.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Patrick M Tesar Sr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

2021CF000091, 2022CF000007, 2022CF000064, 2022CF000065, 2022CF000119
Attorney Burdick is heard on the status of the cases. Requests another status.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:33 AM Cases called - appearances stated. Cases 21CF91, 22CF07, 22CF64, 22CF65 & 22CF119 called together
Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Patrick M Tesar Sr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared by phone. 

22CF119 - Preliminary Hearing
Atty Burdick states def. is waiving preliminary - has reviewed plea questionnaire with defendant

Court questions def. re: waiver of preliminary hearing
Court finds waiver is freely knowingly and voluntarily made, accepts defendants waiver of preliminary hearing and finds probable cause

Atty Burkick states Defendant waives formal reading, stands mute
Clerk directed to enter NOT GUILTY pleas into the record for all counts

Atty Burdick states first four cases are resolved - would be ideal to keep all cases together. Do have an offer on newest case that he will discuss with def. 
Court will schedule all cases for status, if newest case is resolved can get a plea and sentencing date for all
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:38 PM Case called - appearances stated. Cases 21CF91, 22CF07, 22CF64, 22CF65, 22CF119 called together
Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Patrick M Tesar Sr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court - 22CF119 needs Preliminary hearing
Atty. Burdick is heard on status - has received offer on newest case, requests preliminary hearing on most recent case- then all cases can ride together

 Court advises def. that she has signed the conditional release for his forfeiture matters

Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am. (for case 22CF119 only - Status hrg on remaining cases)
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status hearing on September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:35 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Patrick M Tesar Sr.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Burdick is heard on sentencing, requests more time to create a global resolution in all cases including the new case 22CF119.
Status hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:35 AM Cases 21CF91 22CF07 22CF64 22CF65 called - appearances stated. Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick by Atty Ocwieja appeared by video for Patrick M Tesar Sr. Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared by phone. 

Atty. Ocwieja requests a plea/sentencing date - matters are resolved
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.

3:05 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Patrick M Tesar Sr. 

Atty Burdick is heard. 
Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 
22CF64/22CF65 - Information brought over. 

Defendant waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count in case 22CF64 and 22CF65. 
Atty Burdick is heard and they are not requesting a substitution in these cases.
Jury status hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:04 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Patrick M Tesar Sr. 

2022CF000064 and 2022CF65 along together.

Atty Burdick is heard on the status of the two cases. Defendant waives time limits for holding Preliminary Hearing. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Andrew Burdick

2:22 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson making a special appearance via video for defendant. 

State is heard on bond. State requests that defendants bonds be increased by 500.00. Same non-monetary conditions apply. 

Atty Erickson is heard on bond. 
Defendant is heard. 

Court orders that bonds will not be modified or changed. No additional bond money.  Defendant to be released. Bonds still stay the same.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on May 4, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

10:39 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF64 & 22CF65

Court waited ten minutes for defendant to appear.  
Court orders a warrant as to each of these two cases, defendant be held for further hearing.
The State Public Defender's Office indicates they will not have an attorney for the 5/3/22 hearing.  They are working on appointing out because this is a conflict for their office.

11:40 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF64 and 22CF65 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

Defendant still wishes to waive his right to an attorney for these cases.  Court reviews waiver of attorney forms with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 
Court puts on the record that court encourages defendant to get an attorney to represent defendant in all these matters.  Court accepts waiver of attorney. 

Defendant is heard.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on April 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:02 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M. Tesar Sr appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with RB. Defendant shall have no contact with Apt #3 at 229 S. Michigan Street. 

Defendant is heard. Requests a lower bond.

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with RB. Defendant shall have no contact with Apt #3 at 229 S. Michigan Street.

Court advises right to an attorney.  

In Person - Initial Appearance April 27th, 2022 at 11:30 AM
Defendant shall have no contact with RB. Defendant shall have no contact with Apt #3 at 229 S. Michigan Street.
Hearing on April 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
